author: wjmelements
content:
Yes this is a good design and could be used to make common deployments much cheaper.

Solidity introduces the concept of `immutable` fields that are parameterizations of code for deployment configuration. I suspect each tweak would still require a separate code-address deployment though most of the rest is the same. They use `immutable` fields instead of `SLOAD` because the runtime gas is lower. Perhaps these `immutable` fields could be supported with immutable configuration parameters also in the account header, or perhaps `SLOAD` could be made to require less gas by asserting the expected storage value in transaction access lists.

author: wjmelements
content: A similar `immutable` concern was raised with the `CREATE2COPY` EIP https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-5478-create2copy-opcode/10419/10 which was similar to my `CREATELINK` EIP which preceeded it.
